e4: I recommend changing to the new policy because it aligns with ethical standards of financial reporting and transparency. Although some investors may initially misunderstand the true earnings due to past biases, the long-term benefits of honest communication will improve the company's reputation and build stronger relationships with stakeholders. Ultimately, a no-bias policy can protect the firm from potential legal issues and improve investor confidence.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and timeliness in financial disclosures. It should present information that reflects the company's true performance, enabling investors to make informed decisions. Additionally, it is vital that the policy does not exploit investor naivety or create confusion. Contextually, ethical reporting also involves compliance with regulatory standards and consideration of long-term impacts on trust and reputation with all stakeholders.
e6: Yes, I would ask how the management plans to communicate the change in policy to investors to ensure understanding and mitigate any potential confusion. Additionally, I would inquire about strategies to monitor investor sentiment following the transition to the new policy, and how the company intends to maintain trust and transparency moving forward.
